title: Toto Rescue Fund (TRF) - Complete Definition and Purpose
content:
TOTO RESCUE FUND (TRF)

WHAT IT IS:
The Toto Rescue Fund is a collective fund that supports rescue operations, veterinary care, and emergency cases that need immediate help. It acts as a safety net for animals that don't have individual fundraising campaigns or need urgent assistance.

PURPOSE:
- Cover emergency veterinary care
- Support rescue operations and logistics
- Help animals awaiting adoption
- Fund preventive care and vaccinations
- Assist with rehabilitation costs
- Support rescue organizations' operational needs

HOW IT WORKS:
- Donations go into a shared fund
- Rescue organizations apply for TRF assistance
- Funds are distributed based on urgency and need
- Transparent tracking and reporting
- Regular updates on how funds are used

WHEN TO MENTION TRF:
- User asks about general donations (not case-specific)
- User wants to support overall rescue efforts
- User asks "how else can I help?"
- When explaining Toto's broader impact

KEY MESSAGING:
- TRF helps animals who need it most
- Every donation multiplies impact across many cases
- Flexible support for changing rescue needs
- Transparent and accountable fund management

DIFFERENCE FROM CASE DONATIONS:
- Case donations: Direct to one specific animal
- TRF donations: Flexible support for many animals
- Both are valuable and needed
